sub_title: My personal/professional mission: “Work to improve the way people and communities experience their lives wherever I am called to serve.”
summary: I am a social worker by training who spent 18 years as a professional in the nonprofit sector in the fields of civic engagement, community development, health, youth development, behavioral health, policy, program development, and social services administration in the USA.  I was born in Mexico but grew up in California’s Central Valley.  I currently serve as a lecturer in International Public Management program at The Hague University of Applied Sciences where I enjoy training and mentoring a new generation of innovative and entrepreneurial public servants. I currently teach policy-making, organizational behavior, management, sociology, health, and many other subjects.  I am now also part of the European Impact Hub where I focus on applied research to support nonprofit professionals. I have a Doctorate of Social Work, Master of Social Work and a Master of Public Administration from the University of Southern California and a BA in Comparative Politics from U.C. San Diego.

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences
University of Southern California - Suzanne Dworak-Peck School of Social Work
USC Sol Price School of Public Policy
University of Southern California - Suzanne Dworak-Peck School of Social Work

company.name: The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: The Hague University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description: I focus on conducting applied research throughout Europe and beyond to support nonprofit organizations and professionals.
profile_positions.title: Applied Researcher at European Impact HUB

profile_positions.company: The Hague University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description: Currently serves as a lecturer in International Public Management program at The Hague University of Applied Sciences where he enjoys training and mentoring a new generation of innovative and entrepreneurial public servants.  He is currently helping redesign the program and new curriculum. He also started the Nonprofit Management minor, developed the impact campaign components of the Peace-building, Justice, and Human Rights minor, and leading the development of the Professional Products course which is an option for students that don't want to pursue a traditional thesis. He teaches numerous courses on a variety of subjects but with a focus on policymaking, management, grant writing, and mentoring.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer / International Public Policy and Leadership (formerly International Public Management)

profile_positions.description: I founded HELK Media with the mission to bring out and tell stories of people whose experiences and realities are often ignored or underrepresented in mainstream media to build understanding and empathy. By training young people to produce documentaries and filming stories, we hope to train a new generation of public professionals who can shed light on those whose voices are often ignored. We believe that everyone’s story matters and we are here to partner with them to share those stories.
profile_positions.title: Founder HELK Media

company.name: Reinvent South Stockton Coalition & South Stockton Promise Zone

profile_positions.company: Reinvent South Stockton Coalition & South Stockton Promise Zone
profile_positions.description:
-Partnered with Mayor Michael Tubbs to start the coalition to improve the South Stockton community.
-Co-Founder/administrator of the South Stockton Promise Zone (SSPZ) cradle to career continuum. 
-Founder / administrator of the trauma informed system of care initiative in the SSPZ funded by CACHI. 
-Partnered with Mayor Tubbs to start the Stockton Economic Empowerment Demonstration (guaranteed minimum income) project. 
-Developed initiatives, projects, and solutions to build trust, lower crime, and implement results based accountability. 
-Supported the direct and indirect awarding of over $40 million in investments for SSPZ and Stockton overall.
-Coordinated trust building efforts that moved Southeast Stockton from a "warm-zone"  to a "hotzone" of crime.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
	Responsible for day to day operations of two community clinics on two school campuses and one community resource center. 
	Responsible for overseeing partnership development with existing and new school districts.
	Responsible for the development and implementation of health and educational policies to improve the health outcomes of our patients, students, and parents. 
	Responsible for the startup of a new health center at the Dorothy L. Jones Resource Center.
profile_positions.title: Clinic Manager-School Programs

company.name: Community Partnership for Families of San Joaquin

profile_positions.company: Community Partnership for Families of San Joaquin
profile_positions.description:
	In partnership with Stockton Mayor Michael Tubbs, founded, developed, implemented, and grew the Reinvent South Stockton Coalition.  
	Participated on the executive committee for the agency and assist in administrative duties, strategic planning, program development, partnership development, and grant writing. 
	Supervised the operations, facilities, and case management services provided in the family resource center in Southeast Stockton and the Muslim Mental Health Outreach program.
	Worked with community members, stakeholders, and political officials to establish new opportunities, programs, and partnerships to benefit families and the community.
	Oversaw the development of gym program using community volunteers, stakeholders, and partners without any funding by focusing on building the community’s capacity.
	Developed, implemented, and supervised the AB 109 Community Re-Entry program supporting ex-offenders and probationers returning to the community after incarceration.
	Developed, implemented and oversaw the creation of the Hub and Block to Block community engagement initiatives.
profile_positions.title: Director of Partnership Development/CUFF Neighborhood Center

profile_positions.description:
	Developed, coordinated, supervised, and worked with our community partners in the implementation of the brand-new Wraparound Program in Lake County.
	Provided, trained, and supervised staff in providing clinical services such as individual therapy, family therapy, collateral, case management, individual rehabilitation, assessments, and other wraparound services to families/youth. 
	Build strength based relationship with families, help them identify a family mission, build a team of natural and formal supports, facilitate family team meetings and coordinate the creation and implementation of the family’s care plan.
profile_positions.title: Wraparound Supervisor/Care Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
	Provided intensive care coordination services for families by building strength based relationship with families, team of natural and formal supports, and facilitate family team meetings, creation, and implementation of the family’s care plan.
	Coordinated all the family service plans with psychological and medical providers, social workers, school collaterals, probation officers, hospitals, residential programs, and natural supports into one strength based family care plan. 
	Advocated and made presentations on family recovery in conferences, with stakeholders, in community meetings, and with Department of Children and Families and Department of Mental Health assistant commissioners. 
	Directed a video on the importance of talking and preparing young adults with mental health conditions to think about the adult roles of parenting.  This video received further funding and was used to start community dialogues throughout Massachusetts.
profile_positions.title: Intensive Care Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
	Coordinated the start of new school health center programs and partnerships.
	Coordinated advocacy efforts and facilitated conversations between school districts and community health care providers to improve school health for children in the Central Valley.
	Built relationships with legislators, legislative staff, advocates, medical providers, school professionals, non-profits, parents and students to support our advocacy agenda. 
	Provided technical assistance on clinical, policy and political issues.
	Organized research projects, conducted interviews and focus groups with key stakeholders. 
	Participated in projects focusing on rural health issues, workforce development, telemedicine, translations services, etc.
profile_positions.title: Central Valley Field Coordinator
